itemDescription: Footballer, son of England international player (1899-1945)

wikipedia_page.main: Walter A. Abbott (1899 – after 1921) was a footballer who played in the Football League for Grimsby Town.

link_mentions.page: List of Grimsby Town F.C. players

response: Walter Abbott (7 December 1877 – 1 February 1941) was an English professional footballer who scored 104 goals from 391 games in the Football League playing for Small Heath (which was later renamed Birmingham), Everton and Burnley. He was capped once for the England national team.
* Walter Abbott (footballer, born 1877) (1877-1941), English footballer for Small Heath, Everton, Burnley and England
* Walter Abbott (footballer, born 1899), his son, English footballer for Grimsby Town
* Walter Abbott (American football), American football player, coach, college athletics administrator, and university professor
